intro: Holosteum umbellatum subsp. syvaschicum, commonly known as the Syvaschik holosteum, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. It features slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters. The subspecies is distinguished by its morphological traits, including the structure of its leaves and the arrangement of its fruits.
